TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Cursors extends System.Object
public ref class Cursors abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Defines a set of default cursors.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This static class defines a set of default cursors common to applications.
The various static properties defining cursors are not directly usable in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], but are indirectly used through two possible mechanisms:
- The <xref:System.Windows.Input.Cursor> class performs type conversion on any [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] attribute that takes type <xref:System.Windows.Input.Cursor>, such that a value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.CursorType> enumeration specified as the attribute value will evaluate to one of the static <xref:System.Windows.Input.Cursors> properties.
- A static property value can be used through the [x:Static Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/x-static-markup-extension.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property AppStarting As Cursor
public: static property System::Windows::Input::Cursor ^ AppStarting { System::Windows::Input::Cursor ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the that appears when an application is starting.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The typically indicates that the system is loading information, but the user interface can handle input. ## XAML Text Usage See Remark on .
